meanings.definition: Existing at or from the beginning of time; ancient.
meanings.sent1: The primordial rocks in the cave showed signs of great age.
meanings.sent2: The primordial forest was untouched by human hands.
meanings.sent3: The primordial recipe for fire was accidentally discovered by a clumsy caveman.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him felt primordial, as if it had existed since the dawn of time.
meanings.sent5: The primordial darkness of the night enveloped the land in mystery.

meanings.sent1: The primordial rules of the game were easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: His primordial instinct for survival kicked in when he faced danger.
meanings.sent3: The primordial truth that honesty is the best policy is still relevant today.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was built on a primordial trust that never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The primordial colors of red, blue, and yellow are the building blocks of all other hues.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the earliest stages of development.
meanings.sent1: The primordial cells divided rapidly in the petri dish.
meanings.sent2: Her primordial instincts as a mother guided her in caring for her newborn.
meanings.sent3: The primordial chaos of the toddler's room made cleaning up a daunting task.
meanings.sent4: In the primordial days of the internet, dial-up connections were the norm.
meanings.sent5: The primordial seeds of change were sown in the community garden.
